title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 June 2016 - XWiki
content:
<lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
00:59 <ujjwal> has quit  
01:17 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
01:17 <Denis> has quit  
01:51 <lkrejci> has quit  
02:20 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
02:34 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
07:49 <edvorg> has quit  
08:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:20 <vmassol> has quit  
08:30 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <martinus\_\_> has joined #xwiki  
09:02 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <lkrejci> has quit  
09:15 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <tmortagne> fitz: Hi  
10:01 <tmortagne> do you have  few minutes ?  
10:01 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <fitz> yes, I have :)  
10:02 <tmortagne> I tested 0.3 yesterday and while it could access my wiki properly (the setup loaded and listed me the users) the actual synchronization does not seems to have done anything  
10:02 <tmortagne> I could create a user for you if you want to test  
10:03 <msmeria> has quit  
10:03 <tmortagne> is there some debug log somewhere I can send you ?  
10:04 <tmortagne> would be nice to have a way in the application to enable some kind of debug log and send a report, maybe there is some standard tools to do that  
10:04 <tmortagne> hmm wait  
10:05 <tmortagne> I just tested again the setup and I git an error but too quick for me to see  
10:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <tmortagne> it does not seems to list the users anymore  
10:05 <tmortagne> anyway the simplest is probably to create a user for you :)  
10:07 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <tmortagne> fitz: WDYT ?  
10:08 <fitz> ok, I can test by myself.  
10:08 <tmortagne> ha I saw the error this time "network error ! please refesh again!"  
10:09 <tmortagne> what do you do by the way for the credential ? are you saving the login/pass ? some session id ?  
10:09 <fitz> which server ? xwiki.org/xwiki/ ?  
10:09 <tmortagne> nop  
10:09 <tmortagne> I did not tried with xwiki.org  
10:09 <fitz> yes, i have save the user and passwd in AccountManager  
10:10 <tmortagne> ok so it looks like for some reason it lost something after a while (the wiki is up and running)  
10:10 <tmortagne> let me try again to recreate the account and will create a user for you if it still does not work  
10:12 <tmortagne> ha not sure about network issue actually, seems by phone lost connection in général, anyway doing more tests  
10:12 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <fitz> ok :), thank you!  
10:18 <fitz> tmortagne, Yesterday, I tried to use the openid extension. But I can't install in the extension manager  
10:19 <fitz> http://pastebin.com/q2s7R34a  
10:19 <tmortagne> fitz: on which version of XWiki did you try ?  
10:19 <fitz> 8.0  
10:19 <fitz> xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-8.0  
10:20 <tmortagne> you should try 8.1 or 7.4.3, what you get is a bug I fixed not long ago  
10:20 <fitz> ok, thanks  
10:22 <tmortagne> fitz: so I recreated my XWiki account and it worked this time !  
10:22 <tmortagne> great work  
10:22 <tmortagne> would need some error reporting now :)  
10:33 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <fitz> tmortagne, Maybe I can use Google Analytics SDK to collect errors, exception and crash!  
10:37 <fitz> I will update it in the next version!  
10:44 <tmortagne> fitz: by the way you should link to http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Android+authenticator/ in https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/android-authenticator since you moved the documentation there  
10:44 <tmortagne> another question, how do you do a release ?  
10:50 <fitz> tmortagne, now I just generate a key by myself and use it to sign the apk with android studio.  
10:51 <fitz> maybe i should use the gradle script to automatically release the app  
10:51 <tmortagne> fitz: yep that's what I wanted to talk about :)  
10:52 <fitz> you know, now it's just an alpha version.  
10:52 <tmortagne> right now w=one of the issue is that there is no tag corresponding to what you call a release among other things, now for the signing part I don't know but at least for generating the apk it would be nicer  
10:53 <tmortagne> yes I know but it's better to look at those thing early  
10:54 <fitz> and i don't know where to put the key file int the jenkins ? and how to ensure the security if I put the key file in my github repository ?  
10:55 <tmortagne> jenkins is for snapshots, not releases  
10:55 <tmortagne> now for the key it depends what exactly is a key  
10:56 <tmortagne> is it a file you get from the play store for this application ? is this associated to your dev account ?  
10:56 <tmortagne> if it's something related to you then each dev that do release will imply use his own key  
10:57 <tmortagne> then it's a matter of how the release script can be configured to use this key, probably in some configuration file in your user home  
10:57 <fitz> yes, but about how to automatically release?  I will explore ASAP.  
10:57 <tmortagne> for example we sign artifact with our own key when we release XWiki  
10:57 <tmortagne> and the gpg key is set in the maven settings.xml  
10:58 <tmortagne> fitz: I would say it's a bonus  
10:58 <tmortagne> right now I'm mostly interesting is getting proper handmade releases  
10:58 <tmortagne> not sure we really need it to be fully automated but that's your project :)  
11:01 <fitz> https://developer.android.com/studio/publish/app-signing.html  
11:03 <fitz> I just generated a jks key file, sign the app with android studio and upload it to the google play console. that's all.  
11:04 <tmortagne> "you will need to sign your APKs   with the same certificate throughout the lifespan of your app" hmm so all dev must use the same key  
11:05 <tmortagne> so will need to find a secure way for all future release managers of the application to access this key  
11:06 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:06 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <lkrejci> has quit  
11:06 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <tmortagne> fitz: https://www.thoughtworks.com/insights/blog/signing-open-source-android-apps-without-disclosing-passwords looks interesting on this subject  
11:12 <fitz> tmortagne, maybe we'd better generate a new private key!  I just created the key for test version now. :)  
11:12 <fitz> and the key file contains many important information.  
11:15 <tmortagne> you mean personal information about you and it would be better to generate a XWiki project oriented key ?  
11:15 <tmortagne> in any case we need to have the key we want to use in the future ASAP  
11:15 <tmortagne> maybe it's possible to modify information attached to a key  
11:17 <vmassol> has quit  
11:25 <fitz> yes it is! the security of cryptographic techniques is completely dependent on the key.  
11:25 <fitz> tmortagne, About the release, I will explore it later. thank you very much for your reminder :)  
11:26 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has joined #xwiki  
11:27 <tmortagne> fitz: no problem, that's my job to bug you about annoying stuff ;)  
11:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_8> has quit

15:14 <edvorg> has quit  
15:37 <msmeria1> has quit  
16:29 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
16:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: do we have a component in xwiki to get data from a URL using httpcommons?  
16:35 <tmortagne> I don't think so no, we directly use http client when we need to usually  
16:35 <tmortagne> well there is a http client factory for repository handlers but that's all  
16:37 <vmassol> ok so nothing I can reuse  
16:37 <vmassol> I'll just use it directly then for now  
16:38 <tmortagne> depends what you cant to do exactly  
16:38 <tmortagne> there is a lot of tools like this in commons-io  
16:38 <tmortagne> things like FileUtils.copyURLToFile for example  
16:46 <ujjwal> has quit  
16:50 <vmassol> it's for the jira macro  
16:50 <vmassol> I'm currently getting the jira url xml with:  
16:50 <vmassol> createSAXBuilder().build(new URL(…))  
16:50 <vmassol> but I've just realized that this doesn't follow redirects  
16:51 <vmassol> for example on a jira server I'm testing with, http;// is redirected to https://  
16:51 <vmassol> so I was planning to replace this code wiht httpcommons  
16:53 <tmortagne> yea I doubt FileUtils.copyURLToFile follow redirects, you will need a "real" http client  
16:53 <tmortagne> but does not it means you are using the wrong URL in the first place if you are redirected ?  
16:55 <ujjwal> has joined #xwiki  
16:57 <vmassol> indeed  
16:57 <vmassol> it's still better to support redirects  
16:57 <tmortagne> of course  
16:57 <vmassol> got a user of the jira macro who didn't undestand that  
16:57 <vmassol> :)  
16:57 <vmassol> and the secure jira macro does support redirects...  
16:58 <vmassol> the secure jira macro uses groovy parseText(url)… whicch apparently supports directect  
16:58 <vmassol> since that user is moving from that macro to the official jira macro he didn't understand...  
17:04 <vmassol> another point  
17:04 <vmassol> forget that  
17:16 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
17:20 <ol-ow2> Hi, in groovy i've saved a var as xcontext.put("myVar",myValue), after that i'm making a response.sendRedirect(docUrl). is my Var will exist in the xcontext after redirection ?  
17:23 <ClemensR> I do not think so, the context is bound to the current request (usually)  
17:24 <ClemensR> if "myValue" is a string, you could try to save it in the session  
17:24 <ClemensR> ah, I mean: in the session as cookie, but that is nonsense  
17:25 <ClemensR> you can store it in the session as attribute, no matter what datatype, sorry  
17:25 <ol-ow2> as request.getSession().setAttribute("myVar", myValue) you mean  
17:26 <ClemensR> yes!  
17:26 <ol-ow2> ok, i will try that, thanks !  
17:27 <ClemensR> you can remove it from the session on the page after the redirect, that should minify any confusion if the user has several tabs open browsing the same wiki  
17:28 <ol-ow2> noticed ;)  
17:31 <tmortagne> ol-ow2: I confirm that context is tied to the request so you need to use either the session or the cookie  
17:31 <tmortagne> or put what you want as parameter of the redirect URL  
17:32 <tmortagne> depends how safe this information is  
17:33 <ol-ow2> i understand  
17:33 <ol-ow2> thx  
17:34 <ol-ow2> great support, thanks to be here :)  
17:36 <lkrejci> has quit  
17:36 <lkrejci> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <ClemensR> our pleasure :)
